text: What is the primary purpose of RA 6713?

options.text: To establish a code of conduct for public officials

explanation: RA 6713 is known as the 'Code of Conduct and Ethical Standards for Public Officials and Employees'.

text: Ano ang ibig sabihin ng 'public office is a public trust' sa RA 6713?

options.text: Ang pampublikong opisina ay isang pribadong negosyo
Ang mga opisyal ay dapat pagkatiwalaan ng publiko
Ang pampublikong opisina ay pagtitiwala ng publiko at dapat gamitin para sa kapakanan ng publiko
Ang publiko ay dapat magtiwala sa lahat ng opisyal

explanation: Ang prinsipyo ng 'public office is a public trust' ay nangangahulugan na ang kapangyarihan sa pamahalaan ay ipinagkatiwala ng mamamayan at dapat gamitin para sa kanilang kapakanan.

text: Which of the following is NOT one of the eight norms of conduct for public officials and employees under RA 6713?
explanation: The eight norms are: Commitment to Public Interest, Professionalism, Justness and Sincerity, Political Neutrality, Responsiveness to the Public, Nationalism and Patriotism, Commitment to Democracy, and Simple Living. 'Financial Conservatism' is not one of the explicit norms.

text: Under RA 6713, sino ang kinakailangang magsumite ng Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Net Worth (SALN)?

options.text: Ang mga opisyal lamang na inihalal
Ang lahat ng pampublikong opisyal at empleyado
Tanging ang mga opisyal na may Salary Grade 25 pataas
Tanging ang mga pinuno ng ahensya

explanation: Ang lahat ng pampublikong opisyal at empleyado ay kinakailangang magsumite ng SALN ayon sa Seksyon 8 ng batas.

text: According to RA 6713, a public official or employee may not solicit or accept a gift from a person in the course of their official duties. What is the exception to this rule?

options.text: Unsolicited gifts of nominal value not exceeding P1,000
Gifts received during a special holiday or celebration
A gift from a relative up to the fourth civil degree of consanguinity
A monetary gift intended for charitable purposes

explanation: The law (Sec. 7) and its IRR generally prohibit receiving gifts, but allow for 'unsolicited gift of nominal value not given in anticipation of, or in exchange for, a favor' (and the IRR defines nominal value as not exceeding P1,000). Gifts from relatives are also allowed, but the option 'a' covers the most common exception related to official duties.

text: Alin ang itinuturing na 'conflict of interest' sa ilalim ng RA 6713?

options.text: Ang pagkakaroon ng pribadong interes na sumasalungat sa tungkulin niya sa publiko
Ang pagpuna sa isang kasamahan sa trabaho
Ang hindi pagdalo sa isang mandatoryong seminar
Ang pag-uwi ng trabaho sa bahay

explanation: Ang 'Conflict of Interest' ay nangyayari kapag ang pribadong interes ng isang opisyal o empleyado ay nakikialam, o may kakayahang makialam, sa kanyang pagganap sa tungkulin sa publiko.

text: What is the penalty for a first violation of RA 6713, if the violation is not serious and warrants a minor sanction?
explanation: For a first violation, the penalty shall be a reprimand. For the second violation, the penalty is suspension not exceeding six (6) months. For the third violation, it is dismissal from the service (Sec. 11).

text: Under the principle of 'Commitment to Public Interest' (one of the eight norms), public officials should always uphold:

options.text: The exclusive welfare of their political party
The supremacy of the Constitution and the interests of the public
The maximization of their personal income
The protection of their co-employees, regardless of fault

explanation: This norm mandates that public officials must always prioritize the interest of the people over and above personal interest.

text: Sino ang nag-iisyu ng mga alituntunin at regulasyon para sa pagpapatupad ng RA 6713 para sa mga empleyado ng pambansang pamahalaan at lokal na pamahalaan?
explanation: Ang Civil Service Commission (CSC), bilang pangunahing ahensya na namamahala sa serbisyo sibil, ang nag-iisyu ng mga Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRR) para sa pangkalahatang serbisyo sibil (Seksyon 12).

text: The principle of 'Political Neutrality' under RA 6713 requires public officials and employees to:

options.text: Refrain from engaging in any political activity
Provide service to everyone without discrimination and regardless of party affiliation
Always support the current ruling party

explanation: Political Neutrality means public employees should provide service to everyone without consideration of party affiliation, political preference, or religious belief.

text: What is the maximum period within which public officials and employees must act promptly on letters and requests, upon receipt, as mandated by RA 6713?
explanation: Section 5(a) requires public officials and employees to act promptly on letters and requests within fifteen (15) working days from receipt.

text: Ang isa sa mga obligasyon ng mga opisyal at empleyado ay ang 'Simple Living'. Ano ang pangunahing implikasyon nito?

options.text: Hindi pinahihintulutan ang mga opisyal na magkaroon ng anumang ari-arian
Dapat iwasan ang labis na kayamanan o paggasta na hindi tugma sa kanilang posisyon at kita
Dapat nakatira ang lahat ng opisyal sa pampublikong pabahay
Hindi pinahihintulutan ang paggamit ng pribadong sasakyan

explanation: Ang Simple Living ay nangangahulugang dapat iwasan ang labis na kayamanan (extravagant wealth) o pagpapakita ng luho na hindi akma sa suweldo at posisyon ng isang opisyal.

text: Public officials and employees are prohibited from engaging in which of the following acts during their official working hours?

options.text: Engaging in the private practice of their profession (unless authorized)

explanation: Section 7 (b) of the Act prohibits engaging in the private practice of profession or having an outside employment that conflicts with official duties, especially during office hours.

text: The disclosure of financial and business interests in the SALN is primarily intended to prevent what kind of ethical violation?
explanation: The SALN requirement is a transparency measure to ensure that a public official's private interests do not improperly influence the performance of their public duties (Conflict of Interest).

text: Ang prinsipyo ng 'Professionalism' sa ilalim ng RA 6713 ay nangangailangan sa mga kawani na:

options.text: Gumamit ng kasanayan at husay upang maisagawa nang mahusay ang tungkulin
Maging miyembro ng isang propesyonal na organisasyon
Pumili lamang ng mga trabahong nakabatay sa kanilang kurso

explanation: Ang Professionalism ay nangangailangan ng paggamit ng kasanayan, kaalaman, at kahusayan upang magampanan ang mga tungkulin nang may mataas na pamantayan.

text: What is the constitutional mandate reinforced by RA 6713 regarding the relationship between the government and the people?

options.text: The creation of a unitary system
The promotion of the highest sense of accountability and public trust
The establishment of a federal system
The right to form political parties

explanation: RA 6713 is the legislative implementation of the constitutional principle that 'public office is a public trust,' thereby promoting the highest sense of accountability.

text: Ang isang empleyado na nagpapakita ng 'Justness and Sincerity' ay dapat:

options.text: Maging patas, totoo, at hindi mapanlinlang sa lahat ng pakikitungo
Magbigay ng personal na pabor sa kanyang mga kaibigan
Mag-ulat lamang ng mga positibong balita

explanation: Ang Justness and Sincerity ay nangangahulugang pagiging patas, matapat, at hindi mapanlinlang (truthful and not deceptive) sa lahat ng opisyal at personal na pakikitungo.

text: The rule against accepting gifts in RA 6713 is particularly stringent when the gift is given by a person who is the subject of what kind of action by the public official's office?

options.text: A request for a simple document copy

explanation: Section 7 (d) prohibits soliciting or accepting gifts if the giver is involved in a business transaction or professional activity with the official's agency, as this poses the most direct risk of conflict of interest or graft.

text: What does the norm of 'Nationalism and Patriotism' specifically require of public officials and employees under RA 6713?

options.text: To serve the country's interest and uphold the loyalty of the government
To use only the national language in all official communications
To prioritize foreign investors over local businesses
To wear traditional Filipino attire every day

explanation: The norm requires that public officials and employees remain loyal to the Republic and the Filipino people, promote the use of locally produced goods, and generally serve the national interest.

text: The mandatory review and evaluation of the SALNs of government officials is primarily conducted by the:

options.text: Ombudsman and the appropriate Review and Compliance Committee

explanation: The Ombudsman has the constitutional power to enforce the SALN laws, and Review and Compliance Committees within each agency are primarily tasked with the initial ministerial review of SALN submissions (Sec. 8 and its IRR).

text: Public officials are prohibited from using their official information not yet made public for personal gain. This prohibition specifically addresses:
explanation: This is a direct violation of Section 7 (c), the 'Disclosure and Misuse of Confidential Information' rule, which includes the concept of insider trading where non-public knowledge is used for financial advantage.

text: Public officials and employees are required to submit their SALN within how many days after the assumption of office?
explanation: Section 8 requires the SALN to be filed within thirty (30) days after assumption of office, on or before April 30 of every year thereafter, and within thirty (30) days after separation from the service.

text: The principle of 'Commitment to Democracy' requires public officials to uphold and respect which constitutional principle?

options.text: The separation of Church and State.
The rule of law and the constitutional system.
The independence of the Supreme Court.
The right to strike and hold mass actions.

explanation: The norm of Commitment to Democracy requires public officials to commit themselves to the democratic way of life and uphold the Constitution and the rule of law.

text: The prohibition on government officials from directly or indirectly having a financial or material interest in any transaction requiring the approval of their office is intended to prevent:

options.text: Intervention in favor of the official's private business

explanation: Section 7 (a) on 'Outside Employment and Activities' specifically prohibits this to prevent the conflict of interest where the official's private business or material interest improperly influences their public decision-making.

text: If a public official is charged with a crime involving dishonesty or graft, they may be placed under preventive suspension. The primary purpose of this suspension is:

options.text: To ensure the safety of the official
To prevent the official from influencing witnesses or evidence during investigation
To provide the official with a paid vacation

explanation: Preventive suspension is not a penalty; it is a precautionary measure to prevent the official from tampering with evidence or intimidating potential witnesses while the formal investigation is ongoing.

text: Which of the following bodies is primarily tasked with the implementation and enforcement of the 'Simplicity' aspect of the 'Simple Living' norm?
explanation: The Office of the Ombudsman is the constitutional body responsible for investigating and prosecuting graft, corruption, and unjust enrichment, including lifestyle checks derived from the 'Simple Living' principle against the SALN disclosures.

text: The norm of 'Responsiveness to the Public' requires public officials to extend prompt, courteous, and adequate service. Which specific action is mandated by this norm?

options.text: The establishment of a separate lounge for VIPs
The holding of public fora once a month
Processing papers and requests promptly (15-day rule)
Offering free coffee and snacks to all transacting public

explanation: Section 5(a) ('Public Officials and Employees to Act Promptly') is the primary statutory implementation of the 'Responsiveness to the Public' norm, requiring action on letters and requests within fifteen working days.

text: If a public employee is found to have a net worth that is manifestly out of proportion to his/her salary and other lawful income, they may be charged with:
explanation: This scenario directly constitutes a violation of the Anti-Graft and Corrupt Practices Act (RA 3019), which is closely related to RA 6713, and is specifically classified as Unjust Enrichment (or acquiring wealth manifestly out of proportion to income).

text: The provision on 'Disclosure and Misuse of Confidential Information' prohibits public officials from prematurely disclosing information that may be prejudicial to the government. This is a direct implementation of the norm on:
explanation: Misuse of confidential information is a breach of the fundamental trust placed in the official, directly compromising the interest of the public and the government.

text: In the context of the Code of Conduct, what must a public official or employee do if he/she receives a gift of significant value that cannot be accepted under the law?

options.text: Sell the gift and donate the proceeds to charity.
Refuse the gift and report it to the head of the office.
Return the gift to the giver, or, if not feasible, surrender it to the proper office for disposition.
Keep the gift but disclose it in the next SALN filing.

explanation: If the refusal to accept the gift is not possible or practical, the official must surrender the gift to the head of the office or their designated representative for proper disposition (e.g., used by the office, auctioned, or destroyed).

text: The requirement for public officials to provide a list of their relatives within the fourth civil degree of consanguinity or affinity in the SALN primarily aims to identify potential cases of:
explanation: Nepotism (the practice of favoring relatives) is a specific ethical violation that the disclosure of relatives helps monitor, especially when such relatives are appointed to or transact with the official's agency.

text: What is the consequence for a public official who fails to submit his/her SALN on time, as required by law?

options.text: Administrative sanctions, including possible suspension or dismissal

explanation: Failure to file the SALN is a serious violation of RA 6713, which warrants administrative penalties as prescribed in Section 11 of the Act, typically leading to suspension or dismissal upon repetition.

text: The phrase 'A declaration under oath of all their assets, liabilities, and net worth' best describes which part of the SALN requirement?
explanation: The requirement for the declaration to be 'under oath' means the information is attested to before a notary public or official authorized to administer oaths, making it a legal declaration subject to penalties for perjury.

text: The ethical standard of 'Professionalism' also includes a requirement for public officials to:

options.text: Undergo continuous professional development and possess technical competence
Establish a private business related to their official work

explanation: Professionalism involves performing duties with the highest degree of excellence, which requires adequate training, technical competence, and continuous improvement.

text: What is the required frequency for the conduct of value orientation and ethics programs for public officials and employees?
explanation: Section 4 of RA 6713 mandates that all heads of departments, offices, and agencies shall establish and continuously maintain an ethics review system and conduct a value orientation program at least once a year.

text: The provision that the State shall 'promote a high standard of ethics in public service' is found in:

options.text: Article II (Declaration of Principles and State Policies) of the 1987 Constitution
Article XI (Accountability of Public Officers) of the 1987 Constitution

explanation: The constitutional mandate to maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity is encapsulated in Article XI, Section 1: 'Public office is a public trust. Public officers and employees must at all times be accountable to the people, serve them with utmost responsibility, integrity, loyalty, and efficiency, act with patriotism and justice, and lead modest lives.' RA 6713 is the law implementing this provision.

text: The specific prohibition against engaging in the business of a 'Pari-mutuel' or 'Cockpit' during office hours applies particularly to which group of public officials?
explanation: Section 7 (b) states that 'Public officials and employees shall not... engage directly or indirectly in any gambling activities,' which includes 'Pari-mutuel' or 'Cockpit' during office hours. This rule applies to all officials and employees.

text: RA 6713 promotes a high standard of ethics among public officials. Which of the following BEST describes the principle of “public office is a public trust”?

options.text: Public officials may use their discretion in all matters of public service.
Public officials must always act in the best interest of the people.
Public officials should avoid working overtime unless required.
Public officials are allowed to make decisions based on personal beliefs.

explanation: The Constitution and RA 6713 emphasize that public officials must prioritize public interest over personal interest.

text: Which of the following is NOT one of the eight norms of conduct under RA 6713?
explanation: Healthy lifestyle is not part of the eight norms of conduct under RA 6713.

text: Under RA 6713, public officials must submit a Statement of Assets, Liabilities, and Net Worth (SALN). How often must this be done?

options.text: Only when requested by the public

explanation: RA 6713 requires all public officials to file their SALN every year.

text: Which norm of conduct under RA 6713 refers to responding promptly and efficiently to the public's needs?
explanation: Responsiveness to the public emphasizes courtesy and quick service delivery.

text: A government employee refuses to accept a small gift from a client as a token of gratitude. Which norm of conduct is being observed?
explanation: Justness and sincerity include not accepting gifts that may influence official duties.

text: Which of the following acts is PROHIBITED under RA 6713?

options.text: Receiving gifts connected to official duties

explanation: Receiving gifts related to official duties is considered a form of unethical conduct.

text: Under RA 6713, which principle requires public officials to avoid conflicts of interest?
explanation: Commitment to public interest requires prioritizing public welfare over personal gain.

text: A public employee is promoting his own business while on official duty. This violates which norm under RA 6713?
explanation: Professionalism requires employees to perform duties without engaging in personal business.

text: Which of the following reflects 'political neutrality' under RA 6713?

options.text: Supporting a candidate during office hours
Remaining fair regardless of political affiliation

explanation: Political neutrality means avoiding bias in favor of any political group.

text: A citizen requests access to a public employee's SALN. What should the employee do under RA 6713?

options.text: Deny the request unless a lawyer is present
Allow access following the proper procedure
Redirect the citizen to a different agency
Ignore the request if it feels intrusive

explanation: RA 6713 upholds transparency by allowing public access to SALNs when requested properly.

text: A government employee is required to separate from their private business or resign from a board membership within how many days from assumption of office to avoid conflict of interest?
explanation: Section 9 of RA 6713 requires public officials and employees to divest themselves of any conflict of interest within 30 days from assumption of office.

text: Ang isang opisyal ng gobyerno ay nagpakita ng 'courtesy and utmost dedication' sa pagtupad ng kanyang tungkulin. Aling pamantayan (norm) sa ilalim ng RA 6713 ang kanyang sinusunod?
explanation: Ang 'Professionalism' ay kinabibilangan ng pagiging mahusay, mabilis, magalang, at may 'utmost dedication' sa trabaho.

text: Which of the following describes the norm of 'Commitment to Democracy' under RA 6713?

options.text: Upholding the Constitution and loyalty to the Republic
Avoiding political involvement in all activities
Maintaining an excellent work performance record
Ensuring all office transactions are published online

explanation: Commitment to Democracy involves allegiance to the Constitution and the State, and respect for democratic institutions and processes.

text: Ang 'Simple Living' bilang pamantayan sa ilalim ng RA 6713 ay nangangahulugang:

options.text: Hindi pinapayagan ang mga opisyal na magkaroon ng anumang ari-arian.
Mamuhay nang naaayon sa kanilang suweldo at hindi gumagamit ng pampublikong pondo para sa luho.
Dapat sumakay sa pampublikong sasakyan ang lahat ng opisyal.
Limitado lamang ang paglabas sa mga pampublikong lugar.

explanation: Ang Simple Living ay nangangailangan ng pagkakaroon ng pamumuhay na disente ngunit hindi magarbo, naaayon sa kinikita mula sa legal na pinanggalingan, at pag-iwas sa anumang labis na luho.

text: What is the specific maximum monetary value of a gift that a public official may receive from a single source on a single occasion without violating RA 6713?

options.text: Any amount is prohibited if connected to official duty.

explanation: While there is a specific rule regarding 'unsolicited gifts of nominal value', RA 6713 generally prohibits public officials from receiving any gifts, benefits, or promises in connection with their official duties, regardless of amount, to prevent improper influence. Thus, receiving a gift 'connected to official duty' is prohibited.

text: Which action constitutes a 'conflict of interest' under RA 6713?

options.text: A public official voting on a measure that will directly financially benefit their spouse's company.
A government auditor attending a training seminar hosted by a private company.
A school teacher applying for a loan from a government bank.
A state university professor engaging in private consultancy work during their free time.

explanation: A conflict of interest arises when an official's personal interest, or that of a close relative, clashes with their duty, causing bias in decision-making.

text: What is the primary reason for requiring public officials to file a SALN?

options.text: To determine the official's tax liabilities.
To protect the official's assets from public scrutiny.
To monitor unexplained wealth or illicit enrichment.
To calculate the official's retirement benefits.

explanation: The SALN requirement is a transparency measure designed to detect whether an official's assets increase disproportionately to their lawful income, which is indicative of illicit enrichment.

text: The norm of 'Nationalism and Patriotism' primarily requires public officials to:

options.text: Always prioritize the use of imported goods.
Be loyal to the Republic and uphold the Constitution.
Actively campaign for national political candidates.

explanation: Nationalism and Patriotism emphasizes loyalty to the country, respect for the Constitution, and fidelity to public service.

text: A public official is prohibited from accepting any gift in the course of official duties EXCEPT for:

options.text: Gifts received from a foreign official on account of courtesy.
Gifts given anonymously by private citizens.
Any gift given by a relative, regardless of connection to official duty.
Gifts from a company seeking a government contract.

explanation: RA 6713 makes an exception for gifts of nominal value not given in anticipation of favor, or gifts from a foreign government/official given as a gesture of courtesy or protocol.

text: Which agency is primarily responsible for investigating and prosecuting public officials for acts defined by RA 6713, especially those concerning illicit wealth?
explanation: The Office of the Ombudsman has the constitutional and statutory mandate to investigate and prosecute erring public officials, including violations of RA 6713 and related anti-graft laws.

text: If a government official accepts an expensive gift from a contractor, which criminal law is most likely violated, in addition to RA 6713?

options.text: The Revised Penal Code (RPC) on Theft
The Anti-Graft and Corrupt Practices Act (RA 3019)

explanation: RA 3019 specifically prohibits receiving gifts or promises in connection with any official transaction, which overlaps significantly with the ethical prohibitions of RA 6713 and constitutes graft.

text: The norm of 'Justness and Sincerity' requires public officials to at all times:

options.text: Be punctual and efficient in the workplace.
Be true to the people and not compromise their public trust.
Immediately disclose their private bank accounts.

explanation: Justness and sincerity require officials to be honest, consistent, and avoid deceit or making false statements, thereby upholding public trust.

text: What is the requirement for public disclosure of the SALN under RA 6713?

options.text: It can be accessed only by immediate family members.
It is confidential and cannot be viewed by the public.
It must be made available for public inspection, subject to reasonable regulations.
It is disclosed only upon order of the President.

explanation: RA 6713 mandates the public disclosure of the SALN as part of the law's commitment to transparency, subject to rules to prevent harassment.

text: Which specific provision of RA 6713 requires officials to process documents and applications within a reasonable time?
explanation: Responsiveness to the public includes the duty to attend to anyone who comes to the office, act promptly on letters and requests, and submit annual performance reports.

text: A government employee who fails to file their SALN, or files a false SALN, shall be administratively penalized. What is the MINIMUM penalty for the first offense?

options.text: Payment of a fine of P100,000

explanation: RA 6713 specifies that the penalty for the first violation shall be a reprimand. The second violation leads to suspension, and the third to dismissal.

text: A public official is expected to lead a modest life commensurate with their position and income. This is directly related to the norm of:
explanation: Simple Living requires public officials to live a modest life and refrain from extravagant or ostentatious display of wealth that is inconsistent with their known income.

text: The provision that public officials should not solicit or accept, directly or indirectly, any gift or favor in connection with any transaction is a principle under:

options.text: Ethical behavior only for high-ranking officials
The Anti-Graft and Corrupt Practices Act (RA 3019)

explanation: The prohibition on receiving gifts is directly mentioned in the provisions of RA 6713, specifically related to the norm of Justness and Sincerity.

text: How is the net worth of a public official calculated for the purpose of the SALN?
explanation: Net worth is the difference between a person's total assets (what they own) and their total liabilities (what they owe).

text: Which norm is violated when a public official uses their government position to influence decisions for their private gain or that of their family?
explanation: Commitment to public interest requires public officials to act for the public good, which is directly contradicted by using power for personal or family gain (conflict of interest).

text: What is the primary objective of the provision on 'Prohibited Acts and Transactions' in RA 6713?

options.text: To increase government revenue through fines and penalties.
To clearly define boundaries between public duty and private interest.
To regulate the political activities of public employees.
To encourage officials to be more competitive in their private business.

explanation: The prohibited acts section explicitly stops officials from engaging in actions that compromise their public role, such as obtaining loans, having financial interests, or engaging in transactions that conflict with their public duty.

text: If a government official has a conflict of interest, they must divest themselves of their shareholdings or resign from the private board within thirty (30) days. 'Divestment' means:

options.text: Transferring the assets to another government official.
Selling the assets to a third party to eliminate the conflict.
Putting the assets in a blind trust controlled by the government.
Declaring the assets in the next annual SALN.

explanation: Divestment means the act of alienating (selling or transferring) title or control of property by voluntarily, completely, and unqualifiedly being deprived of its private benefit to eliminate the conflict.

text: Which of the following is a key element of the norm of 'Transparency' under RA 6713?

options.text: All public records must be destroyed after one year.
Public officials must keep their financial affairs strictly private.
The public has a right to information on matters of public concern.
Government transactions must be done in secret to protect state security.

explanation: Transparency requires officials to conduct government business openly and ensure the public has access to official records and documents.

text: What are the three mandatory occasions for filing the SALN?

options.text: Upon assumption of office, every July 31st thereafter, and upon separation from service.
Upon assumption of office, every end of the fiscal year, and every three years thereafter.
Upon assumption of office, every April 15th, and upon transfer to another agency.
Upon assumption of office, every April 30th, and upon separation from service.

explanation: The three mandatory filing dates are: within 30 days after assumption of office; on or before April 30 of every year thereafter; and within 30 days after separation from the service.

text: The obligation of a public official to be fair, truthful, and avoid unnecessary lavishness falls under which combination of norms?

options.text: Simple Living and Justness and Sincerity
Responsiveness to the Public and Transparency
Nationalism and Patriotism and Commitment to Democracy

explanation: Simple Living covers avoiding lavishness, while Justness and Sincerity covers being fair and truthful.

text: If a government agency fails to act on a request or letter from the public within the required fifteen (15) working days, which norm under RA 6713 is being violated?
explanation: Responsiveness to the public explicitly requires officials to act immediately and promptly on letters, requests, or public concerns within fifteen (15) working days from receipt.
